intro: Erica cabernetea, commonly known as the Cape heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Erica cabernetea is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
